summary: A hand grenade is a small explosive device that is thrown at a target.
full_text:
The Gregale  is a Mediterranean wind that can occur during times when a low-pressure area moves through the area to the south of Malta and causes a strong, cool, northeasterly wind to affect the island. It also affects other islands of the Western Mediterranean.
The name derives from the Italian grecale, which refers to the island of Zakynthos, in Greece.
This is likely to be the Euroclydon storm, from Greek Euros  and kludo  or Latin Aquilo  "northeaster" or the island Clauda , which wrecked the apostle Paul's ship on the coast of Malta on his way to Rome .
title: Gregale
